elements.title: Me and the Spitter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gaylord Perry (pictured) admitted that he had cheated in baseball in his autobiography Me and the Spitter?

elements.title: Jewish Indian theory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jewish Indian theory, the erroneous idea that some lost tribes of Israel became ancestors to Native Americans, influenced the Book of Mormon?

elements.title: two songs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Billie Eilish released two songs in July 2022, one of which was about a loved one's car accident?

elements.title: Empire Cinema (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a job offer from the Empire Cinema saved science fiction writer John Russell Fearn from factory-based war work that "damned near killed [him]"?

elements.title: Gwinnett Environmental & Heritage Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that upon its completion, the Gwinnett Environmental & Heritage Center had the largest sloped green roof in the United States?

elements.title: Ruffian Games (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ruffian Games co-developed Kinect games to stay in business after the release of Crackdown 2?

elements.title: National Football League record for career punting yards (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the National Football League record for career punting yards is more than 40 miles (65 km)?

elements.title: Hong Taechawanit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "gambling lord" Hong Taechawanit's mansion in Thailand became a police station?
